description_short: Machine learning model for predicting California housing prices
description: This model predicts median house values in California districts based on various demographic and geographic features. It uses the California housing dataset and provides accurate price predictions based on income, location, housing characteristics, and population data.

inputs.name: median_income
inputs.label: Median Income (tens of thousands)
inputs.description: Median income in the block group, measured in tens of thousands of dollars

inputs.name: house_age
inputs.label: House Age (years)
inputs.description: Median age of houses in the block group, measured in years

inputs.name: avg_rooms
inputs.label: Average Rooms per Household
inputs.description: Average number of rooms per household in the block group

inputs.name: avg_bedrooms
inputs.label: Average Bedrooms per Household
inputs.description: Average number of bedrooms per household in the block group

inputs.name: population
inputs.label: Population
inputs.description: Total population in the block group

inputs.name: avg_occupancy
inputs.label: Average Occupancy
inputs.description: Average number of household members (occupancy rate)

inputs.name: latitude
inputs.label: Latitude
inputs.description: Latitude coordinate of the block group location

inputs.name: longitude
inputs.label: Longitude
inputs.description: Longitude coordinate of the block group location

outputs.name: predicted_price
outputs.label: Predicted House Price
outputs.description: Predicted median house value in hundreds of thousands of dollars

outputs.name: price_range
outputs.label: Price Range Category
outputs.description: Categorical price range: low (<$200k), medium ($200k-$400k), high (>$400k)
